intro: Anacampseros albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant features compact, rosette-shaped foliage with thick, waxy leaves that store water, enabling it to thrive in arid conditions. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in spring. It is well-suited for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental appeal.
